Latest Posts

  • Cause and Effect and the Causes and Effects of the Cause and Effect (and so on)

    I’m sitting in a room. I’m sitting in a room because I need to think.
    It’s a thinking room. It’s a thinking room because it helps me think. It helps me think by being empty.
    It’s empty because I hate distractions. I hate distractions because they stop me from thinking.

  • Pitter Patter

    I like the rain.

  • Qwerty

    Well, there was that one time that, in an email to his department head, he ensured her that if she needed any thong, he was the guy to get it.

  • The Valley

    The valley, wedged in between two nearby peaks, was quiet. The orange ball had rolled across the sky, leaving now only streaks of yellow and crimson. Night would be upon the valley soon as the last remnants of heat followed their downward channel.

  • Filet Mignon of the Sky

    They’re so peaceful now - the birds. Flapping from tree to tree, without a care in the world. They sing songs, collect tidbits for their nests, and love it all. At night, they are afraid, but together they stay and together they will be in the morning. On one of these mornings, a dove lands near me, eyeing a puddle; it’s the last sigh of yesterday’s sickly storm. The dove glances in my direction as one of its eyes meets mine. It cocks its head to the left, and then to the right. It is clearly amused by this huge figure that is staring at it. Maybe the birds write about watching people too. I don’t know, their wings may be poetry that we can never understand the simplistic beauty of. Anyways, I lift my pen from the paper I’m rambling on and begin to draw on another.

  • The English Language Constricts Me

    The English language constricts me
    It has trapped me in its nest
    With all its nouns and verb-ery
    It’s really all a mess

  • The Waiting Room

    I sit to stare
    at the wall
    my thumbs a twiddling snare
    passing time by think or draw.

  • Ow!

    In the Autumn air,
    The Spurs and Soles were on the scene,
    It was a war - waged thus fair.

  • VEND

    I take a breath and my insides numb,
    The figure approaches - staring blankly.
    Will it choose the lofty sum?
    Something I enjoy quite frankly.

  • The Dolphin's Jest

    Oh Dolphin!
    I see you there,
    peeking - underneath the briny bumble.
    You wade and wait for my patience to crumble.
    but, as you can see, it is no affair.
